content.en: Drift compensation algorithms: Researchers are exploring various algorithms to address drift compensation in electronic nose (E-Nose) systems. These algorithms, such as extreme learning machines, transfer learning, and multi-task learning, aim to handle issues like discreteness, drift, and disturbance in electronic olfaction. Other approaches include domain correction based on kernel transformation, drift-insensitive features, Wasserstein distance, joint distribution adaptation, adaptive active learning, discriminative domain reconstruction, local manifold embedding, cross-domain transfer, subspace alignment, and domain adaptation. These algorithms are being developed to improve the performance of drifted electronic nose systems and compensate for sensor drift.
content.da: Drifkompensationsalgoritmer: Forskere undersøger forskellige algoritmer for at løse drifkompensation i elektroniske næse (E-Nose) systemer. Disse algoritmer, såsom ekstreme læringsmaskiner, transfer learning og multi-task learning, sigter mod at håndtere problemer som diskretion, drift og forstyrrelse i elektronisk lugtesans. Andre tilgange inkluderer domænekorrektion baseret på kerneltransformation, driftufølsomme funktioner, Wasserstein-afstand, fælles fordelingstilpasning, adaptiv aktiv læring, diskriminerende domænegenskabelse, lokal manifoldindlejring, tvær-domæneoverførsel, under-rumorientering og domæneadaption. Disse algoritmer udvikles for at forbedre ydeevnen af driftede elektroniske næsesystemer og kompensere for sensordrift.
